intro: Dendroseris pinnata, commonly known as the featherleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are deeply lobed and arranged alternately along the stem, while the flowers are borne in a single head at the tip of each branch. Dendroseris pinnata is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or sunny environments.
